name: El San Juan Resort & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had stayed at the El San Juan on three different ocassions in 2006, 2007, 2008 and had great experiences each time. We were excited to go back for a quick weekend getaway but were extremely dissapointed with all the changes since we had been there. We both felt like we were checking into a totally different hotel then the one we had such great memories of. The room and general state of the hotel just felt run down. The walls were all scuffed up and the carpet in the hallways were dirty and looked really dingy. The bathroom was small and dark and the television in the room was tiny. We both struggled to see it from our bed.
reviews.title: Used to love this property...not anymore

reviews.text: The pool area, though still a pretty layout was anything but luxurious. There is nobody around to help you with towels or umbrellas. The crowd was VERY different from what we remembered with a lot of random people using the pool area who had wandered in from the public beach. Security seemed to be doing little to patrol the pool to make sure it was being used by guests only. We heard several people say they werent staying at the hotel but "hanging out" there. This gave the pool area a very spring break in cancun atmosphere-not what we were looking for at all. When we complained to security about the fact non guests were using the facility they didnt seem to care all that much.
reviews.title: great stay
Return Visit
reviews.text: My husband was woken up several times by loud noises in the hallways and banging on the doors
Overall-we will NOT be returning to the El San Juan and will be going to the Ritz Carlton instead.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: every staff member was great, bartenders, beachboys(girls), front desk.
reviews.title: HATED this hotel

reviews.text: We would never stay here again. After reading reviews prior to making reservations, we called hotel and discussed our concerns over the numerous comments about the cleanliness. We gave the hotel the benefit of the doubt assuming more negative reviews were written than positive. That was our first mistake. The negative reviews were right. The hotel was so filthy dirty. Upon entering our room for the first time we saw dirty, sticky floors, mouth and nose prints on our windows, makeup on the comforter cover, hair on both beds and bathroom floors, hair on bathroom sinks, mold in shower, and dirt and grime on bathroom baseboards. This was even after we called to confirm we would be given a clean room. The room was in serious need of updating as the furniture and walls were stained. The place was just gross. Pools and beach were nice but we had to come in sometime! We won't be back.
reviews.title: Filthy dirty and disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying with my husband in November, I feel I am compelled to write a review from my point of view on this property.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else

reviews.text: This hotel starts off great while entering into the main lobby, but then goes downhill fast. Rooms were dirty, smelled of mildew and were decorated by an IKEA clearance center, plastic chairs and all. Bar service is as to be expected. Pools are nice but service is slow around it. Smoke-free property but everyone seems to be smoking with no staff members dis-allowing it.
reviews.title: Great hotel on a nice beach

reviews.text: ----Pros:
reviews.title: Over priced/horrible service

reviews.text: Lobby is beautiful, nice stores inside also
reviews.title: Getting worse

reviews.text: I had one of the rooms away from the main tower. The room was very nice --- lovely porch with full chaise lounge. Separate shower & tub. Toilet closed off from rest of bathroom. Double sinks. Shutters that open from bathroom onto the rest of the room. Nice living area.
reviews.title: Daytime fun, night time fun...

reviews.text: My one complaint is that there was no coffee/tea maker. I like to have a cup before I go to bed and my options were limited to room service.
reviews.title: Good stay for business and short vacation....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two pools, one right outside my window and beach beyond that. When the sun goes down, the sand fleas are out --- ouch! But, if you go in, the lobby of the hotel has nightlife and there's a separate nightclub in the hotel as well. It's worth going down to have a drink just to people watch.
reviews.title: Amazing Place to Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this property for 4 nights in mid April 2013.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Trip

reviews.text: I had business in Puerto Rico, and my husband came along for a short vacation while I was working (lucky). I initially chose the hotel based primarily on it being a Hilton property as I utilize the chain for business travel - also picked this particular Hilton because it was directly on the beach, so hubby could have something to enjoy while I was away during the day.
reviews.title: Amazing trip!

reviews.text: We have been going to Puerto Rico for 5 years. One of the best things to do there is go to the El San Juan Hotel lobby. Their lobby has a warm and lively atmosphere. Most nights there is live music and dancing. You can get a drink at the bar and a few nibblets or just grab a small table and sit back and people watch.
reviews.title: Love the lobby

reviews.text: This visit we brought family and friends with us to help celebrate our wedding. Some hung out in the lobby and danced and had drinks while others mingled in the casino. Everyone danced and had a great time. The lobby is free to hang out and listen to music. This is a family friendly location where everyone will find something to enjoy.
reviews.title: The LEAST kid-friendly hotel we have ever stayed at!

reviews.text: If you have young children, DO NOT stay here! There are absolutely no kid activities except for swimming and the beach. and, of course, you will have to buy your sand toys and pool floats/balls at a ridiculous price. (Tip: go to Walgreens down the street to stock up on beach toys, snacks, etc.) kid friendly food options are also limited because it can take an hour or more to get your kid a simple cheeseburger. However, if you are a group of young party-seeking adults, then you will love it here. There is drinking all day long, parties in the rooms and lobby all night. So loud, and the staff has a very laissez-faire attitude about pot smoking on your balconies mid day apparently!
reviews.title: I wish I could stay longer

reviews.text: We spent a night at El San Juan before boarding the Silver Cloud. All I can say is I wish we had more time to spend there. The staff was extremely helpful. The hotel itself is very clean and well equipped. The room was very spacious and comfortable, with a great bed. Upon our arrival, we were offered cocktails and snacks. Of course, we took the time to enjoy the live music at the lobby. The pool and the beach were very clean. Breakfast was delicious. All in all, highly recommended.
reviews.title: GREAT!!!!!

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to visiting again soon! I have to be honest, after reading some of the negative reviews I was a bit apprehensive about vacationing at this hotel. I emailed Susan Wilkerson, one of the managers prior to arrival and she was reassured me that I would be happy. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would def recommend staying in the main building. The garden lanai area is not as fancy and up to date as the rest of the hotel but has a great location if on the ground level- you can walk right through to the pool. We had an amazing experience. Get to the pool early to reserve seats. Mara, one of the women that helped with check out was very kind and helpful. Guests were also very friendly. We met a lot of fellow NYers.
reviews.title: If you dont like the lobby's nightlife, probably not worth the stay

aka: El San Juan Hotel Isla Verde
description: Oceanfront hotel surrounded by 15 acres of landscaped grounds in fashionable Isla Verde district - 15 minutes from Old San Juan. El San Juan Resort & Casino, A Hilton Hotel presents a perfect blend of tropical splendor, Old World elegance and vibrant culture. Redesigned guest rooms are bright and inviting- ideal for a retreat. Lounge at the beach or on the expansive Encanto Pool Complex featuring flowering gardens, and spacious sundeck, Olympic-sized pool, Fantasy swimming pool with swim-up bar, waterfall and whirlpools, private cabanas for rental or relax and rejuvenate at the Edourad de Paris Day Spa. Enjoy a vibrant and varied nightlife, choosing from nine on-site award wining restaurants, a world-class casino, plus 15 lounges, bars and nightclubs. One life to live? Live it up at El San Juan!
